title: U.S. by-catch data table - percentage calculation

content.description:
The table below shows fish harvest data from United States commercial fisheries in 2011, 2012, and 2013.

2011
 2012
 2013

Total Fish Landings
 <math alttext="6.1" overflow="scroll"> <mstyle> <mrow> <mn>6.1</mn> </mrow> </mstyle> </math> billion pounds
 <math alttext="6.0" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>6.0</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> billion pounds
 <math alttext="6.1" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>6.1</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> billion pounds

Bycatch
 <math alttext="714.2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>714.2</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> million pounds
 <math alttext="601.7" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>601.7</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> million pounds
 <math alttext="689.1" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>689.1</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> million pounds

Fish landings are defined as the total catch of marine fish that are brought into ports for sale. Bycatch refers to the unwanted fish and other marine organisms that are caught during commercial fishing operations, but are not harvested or sold.
content.question: Which of the following methods would you use to calculate the percent of the total catch of all fish in 2012 that was bycatch?

choices.label: <math alttext="the fraction with numerator 6.017 times 10 to the power 8, and denominator 6 times 10 to the power 9, plus 6.017 times 10 to the power 8, end fraction" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>6.017</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>8</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><mn>6</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>9</mn></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><mn>6.017</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>8</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the fraction with numerator 6 times 10 to the power 9, and denominator 6 times 10 to the power 9, plus 6.017 times 10 to the power 8, end fraction" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>6</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>9</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><mn>6</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>9</mn></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><mn>6.017</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>8</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the fraction with numerator 6.017 times 10 to the power 8, and denominator 6 times 10 to power 9, end fraction, times 100" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>6.017</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>8</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><mn>6</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>9</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mfrac><mo>×</mo><mn>100</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the fraction with numerator 6.017 times 10 to the power 8, and denominator 6 times 10 to the power 9, plus 6.017 times 10 power 8, end fraction, times 100" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>6.017</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>8</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><mn>6</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>9</mn></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><mn>6.017</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>8</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mfrac><mo>×</mo><mn>100</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="the fraction with numerator 6.017 times 10 to the power 8, and denominator 6 times 10 to the power 9, plus 6.017 times 10 power 8, end fraction, times 100" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>6.017</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>8</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><mn>6</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>9</mn></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><mn>6.017</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>8</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mfrac><mo>×</mo><mn>100</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>

skill.text: Skill 6.A: Determine an approach or method aligned with the problem to be solved.
